About me

I am Riahi Semah, a 3rd-year student in Information Systems Development. Passionate about technology and its impact, I have acquired a strong knowledge base in key areas such as programming, databases, and web development. I have worked on several practical projects, both individually and in teams, which have allowed me to enhance my software development skills and problem-solving abilities. I am constantly keeping up with the latest technologies and I am ready to take on new challenges in the field. I am open to internship opportunities or practical projects to apply my skills and continue my professional development.

Projects

Commun France

Commun France is an innovative project that aims to transform the way information and location details are accessed based on names. Our cutting-edge platform utilizes advanced technologies and frameworks, including Node.js for the backend and Vue.js for the frontend, with MongoDB as the database system. With Commun France, users can easily search for information and location details by simply entering a name. Our platform retrieves comprehensive information and provides accurate location details related to the search query. By leveraging location-based services, we ensure that users receive the most relevant and up-to-date results

See Live Source Code

MyCat

Projet MyCat is an exciting endeavor that caters to cat enthusiasts, offering a comprehensive platform for adopting and buying high-quality cats. Powered by advanced technologies, the project utilizes Symfony 6 for the backend, Twig for frontend templating, and Bootstrap for a visually appealing and responsive frontend design. The database system of choice is PostgreSQL, ensuring robust data management

See Live Source Code

Student Management

The Student Management Project is a comprehensive platform designed to streamline student administration tasks. Leveraging Angular and Bootstrap technologies, the project offers a user-friendly and responsive interface for efficient management of student information. Oracle is utilized as the robust database system, ensuring reliable data storage and retrieval

See Live Source Code

Employee Management

The Employee Management Project is a comprehensive platform designed to streamline employee administration tasks within organizations. Leveraging HTML, CSS, and Bootstrap for the frontend and Java EE for the backend, the project offers a user-friendly and visually appealing interface for efficient management of employee information. The project utilizes phpMyAdmin as the database management system, ensuring secure storage and retrieval of employee data.

See Live Source Code
